recipes.label: A Discarded Mystery
recipes.startdescription: Hundreds of dancers have passed through this changing room. Now and then one finds their traces like dropped petals: a lost glove, a faded photograph, an admirer's note...
recipes.description: A crumpled poem - a dozen pages long - has been stuffed into an abandoned shoe. Not a love poem. I'm almost sure it's not a love poem. But when I read it, my breath comes faster, and I wonder if I am remembering something I had lost.

recipes.label: Consider the Crumpled Poem as a Physical Challenge
recipes.startdescription: Is this some sort of code? Are there hints here towards an unusual set of dance steps?
recipes.description: The directions are coming clear. There are steps, certainly - steps I begin to feel - and the steps end somewhere - somewhere beneath waking life. Somewhere I'm different. I rotate my shoulders: why does it feel as if my skin does not quite fit?

recipes.label: Consider the Crumpled Poem as a Dream-Challenge
recipes.startdescription: I think I dreamt something like this, once, on a night when the moon dappled the sheets of my bed - when I dreamt that my hands were not exactly hands, that something more than blood pulsed under my skin - and that skin was not the skin I wear. What if I could find something of that dream again?
recipes.description: I lie awake half the night, convinced there is something in my room. A little after midnight it occurs to me that I am that something; and I fall gratefully into sleep.

recipes.label: A Dream of Another Self
recipes.startdescription: In my dreams, it's coming clear. This is a dance one cannot perform alone, nor with a partner. This is a dance one dances with a doll.
recipes.description: I've performed the steps, with a rag doll, but it wasn't quite right. When I peeled the doll's fabric away like skin, I felt relief, but then, of course, it fell apart... Something is wrong - wrong with the doll, or the world, or me.
recipes.comments: opened from studying about first plot object with health

recipes.label: A Dream of an Older Self
recipes.startdescription: Tonight I'll cut a lock of my hair before I sleep. I read that in the poem. Snip; snip.
recipes.description: I dreamt of a great Wood at the heart of the first continent where we moved among the trees, dark and light and dark again, up and down and into the fire. I dreamt that once we were something else - or something else was us. Once perhaps we were things with wings. Sometimes, now, my shoulder blades itch.
recipes.comments: opened from studying about first plot object with passion

recipes.label: A Dream of an Older Self
A New Partner
recipes.startdescription: Sometimes in the afternoon I prowl the street-markets. I danced the dance of the poem, and I ruined my rag doll. There must be a better doll out there, so I can stamp those steps again.
recipes.description: I found it! Sold as flotsam for a half-shilling. It's not exactly right, but it's close. Its surface, its scars, the shape of its limbs.

recipes.label: An Old Partner
recipes.startdescription: When the moon is out I slip over the fence into the locked park, looking under branches in the hollow places. I don't know why, yet.
recipes.description: I found a package dropped in the mud. I knew at once it was what I was looking for. Perhaps it was meant for me, perhaps I stole it, as one might steal an abandoned baby. In the winged dream of the Wood, I danced with something a little like it.

recipes.label: What We Say And When We Say It
recipes.startdescription: Do I have something in common with some of those who watch me?

recipes.label: Plead for Reinstatement at the Gaiety Theatre
recipes.startdescription: I need the job back. I'll tell them it'll be different this time. Perhaps they'll understand.
recipes.description: I didn't beg; not quite.

recipes.label: Perform at the Gaiety Theatre
recipes.startdescription: The stage awaits, hot and clean and bare and bright. If I move the moves and step the steps and do what is required, they'll pay me.

recipes.label: An Opportunity at the Gaiety Theatre
recipes.startdescription: Tonight I sense opportunity. Tonight I could attract attention, if I cease to hold back, if I commit myself more fully.
recipes.description: I stayed aloof. I moved the moves and stepped the steps and did what was required, and now they'll pay me.
recipes.comments: the better outcomes require heart or moth 2: enough for abilities or for restlessness, too much for fatigue

recipes.label: A Potential Benefactor
recipes.description: A gentleman has prevailed on the stage manager to arrange an introduction to me backstage. He is courteous; he says all the right things about my work; he has brought a gift. He hopes that we can be friends.

recipes.label: A Potential Benefactor
recipes.description: A lady has arranged for us to be introduced in the glittering cafe across the street. She is very complimentary; she listens attentively to everything I say; she has brought a gift. She hopes that we can be friends.

recipes.label: A Message from an Admirer?
recipes.description: A hand-delivered letter, addressed to me. It smells strongly of cigarette smoke and cloves. It reads: 'If you need to talk to someone about your dreams, find me here. Don't call until you're ready.' There is a telephone number and a name: Sulochana.

recipes.label: I am a lissom package of flesh and blood.
recipes.startdescription: Tonight, they'll notice that.
recipes.description: I felt all their eyes upon me. Afterwards, I received a gift from an admirer - too gaudy for my tastes, but I can sell it in the second-hand market.

recipes.label: I am more than a lissom package of flesh and blood.
recipes.startdescription: Tonight, they'll notice that.
recipes.description: I felt all their eyes upon me. Afterwards, I received a gift from an admirer - a little too personal for me to feel comfortable, but I can sell it in the second-hand market.

recipes.label: Perform for a Benefactor
recipes.startdescription: My Benefactor would be delighted if I'd offer a private performance for a small and refined audience. They'll invite me to dinner afterwards, and of course offer suitable gifts in return for my time.

recipes.label: My Benefactor: Energy
recipes.startdescription: Tonight, my Benefactor is full of energy. I should be, too!

recipes.label: My Benefactor: Inventiveness
recipes.startdescription: Tonight, my Benefactor would be pleased by inventiveness; enthusiasm; brio. Passion.

recipes.label: My Benefactor: Fresh Colours
recipes.startdescription: Tonight, my Benefactor will prefer to see me in something new. I should buy something, quickly...

recipes.label: My Benefactor: the Life of the Mind
recipes.startdescription: Tonight, my Benefactor's mood is conversational.

recipes.label: My Benefactor Finds Me Engaging
recipes.description: After the performance, I am flushed and I am perspiring, but my Benefactor seems to like that. They have brought me a glittering little something.

recipes.label: My Benefactor Is Delighted
recipes.startdescription: All the guests applaud with real conviction! My performance has gone down well. Afterwards, my Benefactor is respectful and affectionate. I have a souvenir of the evening - quite an expensive one.

recipes.label: My Benefactor Watches Me Fondly
recipes.description: I've chosen my attire well for the performance. My benefactor showers me with compliments, and gifts.

recipes.label: My Benefactor Finds Me Engaging
recipes.description: The performance is shorter than usual, but the conversations - with the other guests, and later, just my Benefactor - go on well into the night. I come away with a handsome gift.

recipes.label: My Benefactor Finds Me Engaging
recipes.description: Tonight, I danced and I laughed and I was charming with my Benefactor and delightful with our guests. Everyone is happy. And I have a little something - something enough to live on for a good while.

recipes.label: My Benefactor is Restless
recipes.description: For whatever reason, despite my best efforts, my Benefactor does not seem interested in me tonight. They do make an effort to bid me a courteous goodbye, but their customary gift seems like an afterthought.

recipes.label: Has My Benefactor Tired of Me?
recipes.startdescription: I've heard nothing from my Benefactor in days...
recipes.description: When I call, I am informed that no-one is receiving visitors. Three times I am assured it. Finally, I receive a modest gift with a polite note wishing me well for the future. It is unsigned. Perhaps no-one sent it.

recipes.label: Is my Benefactor about to Propose?
recipes.startdescription: They have an air of suppressed excitement tonight.

recipes.label: Is my Benefactor about to Propose?
recipes.startdescription: They have an air of suppressed excitement tonight.
recipes.comments: Identical to proposes_always, but with a lower threshold

recipes.label: Accept a Proposal of Marriage
recipes.startdescription: I have been offered marriage - marriage into the nobility. Peace, prosperity, comfort, and the affectionate companionship of my Benefactor for the remainder of my life. I must be sincere. If I cannot experience sincerity, I must manufacture it.
recipes.description: My Benefactor still waits, face clouded.

recipes.label: 'Yes!'
recipes.startdescription: Now I will leave this place, and enter another state of being. A happy one, it is to be hoped -
